title: Launch EKS cluster worker nodes for UD/UCMDB
content:
This task is required only when you need to install UD/UCMDB. See Sizing guides (EKS) for information about the additional EKS cluster worker nodes required to deploy UD/UCMDB. 

Launch EKS cluster worker nodes for UD/UCMDB

  1. Navigate to the smax-managed-workernode.template file under ../Cloud Deployment x.x.x/byok/smax-cloudformation-aws in the cloud deployment package.
  2. Create a copy of the smax-managed-workernode.template file and rename the new file to cms-managed-workernode.template.
  3. Open the renamed file, replace smax-cluster and smax-workernodes to cms-cluster and cms-workernodes, and then save the file.
  4. Use the updated cms-managed-workernode.template file to create additional EKS cluster worker nodes for UD/UCMDB based on the EKS cluster that you have created for the suite, and specify a dedicated Worker Node Group name for UD/UCMDB. For reference, see the steps that you performed for the suite as described in Launch EKS cluster worker nodes.

Specify a label for the UD/UCMDB node group

Perform the following steps:

  1. Go to EKS and locate the EKS cluster you created.
  2. Click the cluster, and then click Compute to find Node group.
  3. Click the node group that you have created for UD/UCMDB, and then click Edit.
  4. Edit the Kubernetes labels information as follows.
    Key Value
    role loadbalancer
    node.type worker
    Worker cms
  5. Click Save changes.

Verify

  1. After you create the worker nodes for UD/UCMDB, run the following command on the bastion node to check that you have successfully assigned the cms label to the worker nodes: 
    kubectl get nodes --show-labels
  2. Review the output returned for the command above by checking if you can see Worker:cms as the label for the worker nodes.
